patterns: What is the benefit of launching an MVP?
Is MVP good for testing ideas?
responses: An MVP, or Minimum Viable Product, is the simplest version of a product that solves a real problem and can be released quickly to get user feedback.
Building an MVP helps you test your idea in the real world with minimal cost and time. It's a smart way to learn before scaling.
MVPs are used to validate product ideas early. You launch fast, get real user feedback, and decide what to build next based on data.
Startups often begin with an MVP to check market fit, attract investors, or gather feedback before investing in full-scale development.
An MVP saves time and money by helping you focus on core functionality first. You build, test, and improve step by step.
An MVP is perfect if you want to bring an idea to life quickly and understand if it truly meets user needs.

patterns: Can you explain your MVP approach?
How do you handle MVP development?
Do you follow a process for MVPs?
Tell me how 88 Hours builds MVPs
How do you make MVPs quickly?
Do you validate ideas before building?
How do you turn ideas into MVPs?
responses: We follow a lean, user-first approach. We understand your idea, prioritize key features, and launch a working MVP within weeks—ready for testing or pitching.
Our MVP process starts with clear goal setting, rapid prototyping, and iterative development. You get a working product fast, with real value.
We work closely with you to define what matters most, design fast, build smart, and get your MVP to market quickly for feedback.
At 88 Hours, we combine rapid prototyping with smart architecture, so your MVP is not just fast it is scalable and ready to evolve.
We help you test assumptions early by launching a working MVP with essential features. Then we use feedback to guide future development.
Our MVP workflow is fast and collaborative: discovery, prototyping, development, launch. We keep it agile and focused on results.

patterns: What is your company all about?

responses: 88 Hours is a creative and fast-moving company that helps bring ideas to life. We work with startups and businesses to build great digital products.
We're a passionate team that supports founders and innovators by helping them turn ideas into real, working products.
88 Hours is all about helping people launch and grow new ideas. We work closely with businesses to build strong digital solutions.
We are a company that loves solving problems and building things that matter. At 88 Hours, we focus on making your ideas real.
88 Hours partners with startups and teams to build and grow digital products, making innovation easier and faster.
We exist to help entrepreneurs, creators, and businesses build new things and bring their visions to reality.

responses: We follow an agile, sprint-based development approach—designed for speed, feedback, and adaptability. This allows us to deliver quickly while staying aligned with evolving client goals.
Our teams work in short, focused sprints, with frequent checkpoints to gather feedback and make fast, data-driven adjustments to the product roadmap.
We collaborate closely with clients through each phase—from planning to delivery—ensuring transparency, flexibility, and rapid progress throughout the development cycle.
Our process combines Agile best practices with design thinking and lean startup principles to move quickly from idea to product without sacrificing quality.
